Title: Senior Assistant Store Manager, Sales & Retail Engagement
RoleDescription:
Senior Assistant Store Manager, Sales & Retail Engagement
Location: 1801 Howell Mill Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30318
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $117,000 - $130,000, however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Overview: 
At Wayfair, we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in furniture and home by empowering talented, driven individuals like you. As a Senior Assistant Store Manager of Sales, youll lead the sales floor team/ This includes sales, design, and customer experience to create seamless, welcoming shopping journeys. Youll be a key partner to the General Manager, driving sales, optimizing operations, and fostering collaboration across specialty categories like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses. If youre passionate about coaching teams, solving challenges in a fast-paced environment, and delivering authentic, customer-focused service, your professional home awaits you here at Wayfair.
What Does a Sr. Assistant Store Manager Do?

 Lead Sales & Design Teams: Directly manage and develop the sales floor team, including managers, sales associates, designers, and customer experience specialists, ensuring customers receive top-notch support and service.
 Be a Senior Operational Partner: Serve as a key-holder and senior support across Assistant Store Manager duties, especially in specialty areas like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses, to keep store operations running smoothly.
 Unite Store Teams: Collaborate across Salesfloor, Logistics, Visual, Asset Protection, Talent, and more to align goals and execute store-wide initiatives that elevate customer experience and business success.
 Champion Customer Experience: Deliver authentic, friendly service while coaching your team to build complex, connected solutions that balance speed with personalized attention.
 Drive Sales & Results: Partner with the General Manager to optimize our store processes, manage profitability, control labor expenses, and translate data into actionable coaching and team improvements.
 Foster Collaboration & Culture: Create a positive, team-first environment by encouraging cross-functional collaboration and continuous growth among Associates, Specialists, and Designers.
 Own Floor Operations: Maintain strong leadership presence as Manager on Duty handling scheduling, opening and closing procedures, and ensuring the right team is in the right place at the right time.
 Innovate & Improve: Contribute ideas for new tools, processes, and technologies that help your teams work smarter and more efficiently.
 Manage Multiple Priorities: Stay organized and communicate clearly while juggling fast-paced demands and following through on action plans.
 Partner with Home Office: Work closely with corporate teams to share insights and support store performance enhancements.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Proven Leadership: 5+ years managing large teams in fast-paced, high-volume retail or specialty selling environments, where you led with confidence and clear direction.
 Customer-Obsessed: Strong background in selling and delivering exceptional, authentic customer servicealways focused on creating memorable experiences.
 Operational Excellence: Experience driving processes and operations as designed, with a knack for optimizing workflows and boosting team performance.
 Analytical Mindset: Comfortable diving into data, interpreting KPIs, and making smart, data-driven decisions to continuously improve results.
 People Developer: Skilled at coaching, mentoring, and motivating others, fostering growth and accountability with empathy and professionalism.
 Cross-Team Collaborator: Able to bring together multiple teams and functions, aligning diverse stakeholders behind a common goal.
 Tech Confident: Comfortable using Google Suite, inventory management systems, and ready to quickly learn new tools that empower your team.
 Flexible & Dependable: Willing to work varied retail hours including early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays to meet business and customer needs.
 Hands-On Attitude: Ready to jump in on the floor or in the warehousewhether its stocking shelves, managing inventory, or helping with physical tasks.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and performance based bonuses.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Take the time you need with our generous PTO policy for L4+ leaders which is designed to support work-life balance while aligning with our business needs and team priorities.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.

Title: Wayfair Stores, Recruiter
RoleDescription:
The role is based out of our Wilmette,IL Wayfair store and is fully onsite Monday through Friday. This role requires some flexibility to work occasional weekends or in-store events
The salary range for this position is $60,800-69,588/yr however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
At Wayfair, we believe great people build great teams, and that starts with you. As our Retail Recruiter, you'll be the engine behind our store's talent strategy, ensuring were hiring the right people, at the right time, for the right roles. Youll build strong partnerships with store leaders, understand the unique needs of each department, and deliver a candidate experience that reflects our brand: welcoming, helpful, and a little playful.
This role is equal parts relationship-builder, problem-solver, and brand ambassador. Youll manage everything from traditional and creative sourcing, to screening candidates and offer letters, to candidate onboarding details and process changes. All of this, while constantly staying two steps ahead of the hiring curve. If you thrive in fast-paced and changing environments, love connecting people to purpose, and take pride in creating seamless hiring experiences, this role could be your professional home.What Youll Do:

 Own Onsite Recruitment: You will primarily serve as the face of Talent Acquisition in the store, working onsite five days a week to build strong, in-person relationships with stakeholders, hiring managers, and future team members.
 Understand the Business Inside & Out: Develop a deep understanding of each hiring manager and department, including Logistics, Visual, Sales, Design, Retail Engagement, and Asset Protection, to deliver qualified talent aligning with both role requirements and team culture.
 Source Strategically & Creatively: Leverage tools like Avature, GEM, Visier, and Greenhouse along with creative, boots-on-the-ground sourcing efforts. You will use this to build strong pipelines, generate quality applicant flow, and attract talent in both expected and unexpected places.
 Own Job Postings and ATS Accuracy: Create, update, and maintain job postings with precision while ensuring the applicant tracking system remains accurate, organized, and optimized for hiring success.
 Deliver Exceptional Hiring Experiences: Champion clean, consistent, and positive candidate and hiring experiences that reflect Wayfairs values from start to finish.
 Coordinate Recruiting Events: Support community hiring initiatives, job fairs, store promotional events, and external partnerships that generate buzz and attract great talent.
 Act as a Recruiting Subject Matter Expert: Provide leadership guidance on hiring strategy, process improvements, and talent insights, while escalating issues thoughtfully and offering proactive solutions.
 Balance Priorities with Precision: Manage competing demands across multiple roles and departments through smart prioritization, clear communication, and confident decision-making, understanding your return on investment.
 Drive Stakeholder Alignment: Build trust quickly, manage feedback, interview loops, and align cross-functional partners toward shared hiring goals, while surfacing key insights and trends to your TA Leadership Team.
 Adapt and Iterate: Embrace feedback, adjust to change, and continuously improve the hiring process by solving challenges and bringing forward fresh ideas.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Stakeholder Relations: You build trust quickly and can partner confidently with hiring managers across departments to deeply understand who and what they need on their teams.
 Sourcing Creativity: You bring fresh ideas to the top of the funnel and are comfortable with boots-on-the-ground recruiting, as well as  using tools like Indeed, GEM, and social platforms to spark applicant flow and uncover hidden talent.
 Recruiting Experience: You have 1+ years of experience in a high-volume corporate or agency recruiting environment and are eager to continue growing your TA expertise.
 Detail Discipline: You are highly organized while moving fast, keep systems clean, follow through flawlessly, and know how to juggle shifting priorities with ease while remaining in accordance with deadlines in a high-volume environment.
 Clear and Confident Communication: You communicate with clarity and professionalism across varying audiences that may require different approaches or messaging.
 Growth-Ready Mindset: Youre adaptable, take feedback in stride, and bring a proactive, can-do attitude to change and new challenges.
 In-Person Energy: This is a fully on-site role, and you shine in face-to-face environments where building in-person relationships makes a lasting impact.
 Talent-Spotting Everywhere: You believe great talent is all around us and treat every interaction as a potential recruiting opportunity, whether its during a shift, a store visit, or out in the community.

Title: Software Engineer III, Dynamic Pricing and APIs
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are required to be based in Boston MA, and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements (Tues-Thurs in office, Mon and Fri remote).
Who We Are:
At Wayfair, the Pricing Engineering teams develop tools, data streams, and algorithms  to optimize and manage profit, revenue, and price perception.  We work with a large set of data, including all cost and price impacting data points for the entire catalog. This helps the business set competitive prices, drive promotional sales, and manage margin expectations.  We work at a fast pace and maintain a high performing system. 
We are looking for engineers that will help us tackle important work on our roadmap. We are looking for engineers that will help us tackle important.  This may include, but is not limited to, continuing our Tech transformation towards Cloud Native solutions, and work on our next generation Dynamic Differential Pricing  Systems.  
These tasks are accomplished through cutting-edge technology stack on the Google Cloud Platform, including C# and Java-based microservices, GraphQL, and Distributed Storage. If you're interested in joining a dynamic engineering team that thrives on innovation and scaling to meet increased customer demand, we'd love to hear from you.
What Youll Do:

Lead, mentor, code, and review for best practices, stability, and uptime.
Collaborate cross-functionally to understand the domain.
Own platform architecture, driving scalable technology and roadmap decisions.
Implement and advocate engineering best practices, leveling up engineers.

Uphold high-quality standards, advocating for best practices and leading code reviews.
Explore and implement new technologies and frameworks.
Use e-commerce business knowledge to convert product requirements into technical solutions.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

7+ years of experience and deep understanding of C# programming language

Ability to provide visibility to progress through short feedback loops and data-driven action
Successful background designing production systems at scale including fault tolerance, reliability, performance, and security
Experience with scaling distributed systems, streaming technologies, microservice architectures in a cloud environment (ideally Google Cloud Platform)
Passion for leading a large, cross-cutting technical initiative to delivery, cross-functional consensus building and influencing design decisions.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience with Cloud Native architecture platforms like Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure.
Experience working with relational and non-relational databases
Experience working with event-driven architectures, DDD, and TDD
Experience and desire to work in an agile environment
Preferred experience in the CI/CD tools/platforms like Buildkite/Docker/Kubernetes.
Experience in system monitoring using tools like DataDog etc.
Experience in development and technical design of frontend and backend applications from start to finish
Understanding of functional programming and javascript best practices
Experience and deep understanding of atomic design (reusable components)

Title: Senior Marketing Manager, YouTube, Audio & Programmatic Media
RoleDescription:
Senior Marketing Manager, YouTube, Audio & Programmatic Media
 [People Manager | Integrated Digital Media Lead]
Wayfair is looking for a strategic, agile and results-oriented leader to oversee our YouTube, Audio, and Programmatic Video media investments. In this role, you will manage a high-performing team responsible for shaping and executing full-funnel media strategies across these key emerging channels. You will lead our partnerships with major media partners such as YouTube, Spotify, The Trade Desk, iHeart Radio and more, while guiding our growth and performance through smart audience strategies, innovative ad formats, buy types, and creative.
As digital media consumption shifts rapidly, this leader will ensure we stay ahead of trends, implement best-in-class buying strategies, and drive measurable impact on both brand health and customer acquisition goals. The ideal candidate will bring depth of experience in YouTube and programmatic platforms, a strong fluency in audience targeting and measurement, and experience mentoring and scaling teams.
What You'll Do:

Lead the vision, strategy, and execution for YouTube, Programmatic Video, and Audio (streaming, podcast, terrestrial radio) channels.
Manage and develop an in-house team of media buyers and marketing analysts, setting strategic direction, coaching for growth, and ensuring operational excellence.
Lead relationships with media agencies, technology vendors, and publisher partnersensuring best-in-class execution, transparency, and continuous innovation.
Own cross-channel investment strategybalancing brand and performance goals while driving efficiency and incrementality.
Develop the creator strategy and operational plan across YouTube & Audio, utilizing 3p partners to build relationships and deliver a high volume of platform-native content
Act as the subject matter expert on YouTube, ensuring advanced capabilities in targeting, creative formats, bidding strategies, and measurement frameworks are leveraged across campaigns.
Oversee programmatic media buying managing partners (DSPs, SSPs, DMPs), ensuring supply quality, and executing private marketplace (PMP) and guaranteed deals.
Collaborate closely with analytics to design and implement measurement frameworks (e.g., brand lift, incrementality testing, MMM), and deliver reporting that connects media investment to business outcomes.
Partner with creative, brand, product marketing, and audience teams to develop briefs and ensure creative assets are optimized by channel.
Manage and optimize media budgets, ensuring pacing accuracy, surfacing reallocation opportunities, and advocating for investments based on data and market trends.

What Youll Need:

8+ years of experience in digital media strategy, planning, or buying, with specific depth in YouTube and programmatic platforms (e.g., DV360, The Trade Desk). 
3+ years of experience managing and developing media teams, with a track record of cultivating talent and building a collaborative, high-performance culture.
Experience managing 8-figure media budgets with a balance of strategic forward-planning and real-time agility
Strong understanding of the full digital media ecosystem including CTV/OTT, programmatic display, audio, and biddable platforms.
Hands-on knowledge of YouTube ad formats (e.g. Video Action, Masthead, Shorts), performance optimization strategies, and lift studies.
Experience with programmatic best practices, including audience strategy, inventory management, frequency control, brand safety, and identity resolution.
Experience managing large media budgets with accountability for business outcomes.
Proficiency in measurement platforms (GA4, Nielsen, MMM, MTA, Lift studies), with ability to synthesize insights and guide optimization decisions.
Experience leading cross-functional planning with internal stakeholders, agencies, and external partners.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with confidence presenting to senior stakeholders and executives.

Title: Senior Associate, Global Findability Operations
RoleDescription:
Senior Associate, Global Findability Operations
*At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
Who We Are
In the Catalog Health team, we strive for a healthy catalog to instill customer trust by ensuring only products that meet Wayfair standards are findable on site in the right way at the right time, supplied by right-fit-for-Wayfair partners that operate within our Code of Conduct expectations. 
How is this opportunity unique?
On the Global Findability team, you will have a unique opportunity to serve as the connective tissue that works to holistically increase the health of the entire catalog. You will help develop the strategy of the platform that governs product offering, working cross functionally to create feedback loops enabling quick resolution for suppliers looking to re-list affected products. Members of this team must be able to clearly analyze a problem and partner effectively with a wide variety of stakeholders to push for short & long term solutions. 
Wayfair is a data-driven environment, so candidates with experience working with complex data to drive decision making are a perfect fit. Strong communication, and being able to distill complex instructions or context up & down the chain is key. As a leader in the findability operations space, we need to have a 360 degree view of key product requirements across the org, and understand the levers to pull to resolve product level or large scale issues effectively. 
We like to have fun. Our team takes time each month to celebrate our wins and toast our accomplishments.  We foster an environment that values balance, and we encourage personal development by offering a broad spectrum of opportunities for continuous development and mentorship.
What Youll Do

Be the end to end owner of the findability operational workflow, managing multiple Offshore teams working to ensure fast turnaround time & high quality for inbound requests. 
Proactively identify trending issues & leverage teammates to find creative and effective solutions with a holistic approach. 
Act as the primary representative for findability operations, partnering with cross functional teams to optimize handoffs multi layered issues. 
Develop processes to hold internal teams & external vendors accountable to the data, ensuring honest invoicing practices and a seamless approval process for different types of vendor contracts.
Create and enforce guidelines for best practices for product requirements, keeping in mind ease of use for actioning teams while also providing an easily understandable experience for suppliers & internal stakeholders. 
Learn and grow the knowledge of the findability platform. Create relationships with key partners by acting as a steward of the system as a whole, helping to troubleshoot platform issues or pursuing more effective ways users can leverage the platform.
Make connections between seemingly unrelated scenarios, with an entrepreneurial spirit & mindset geared towards thinking out of the box.

 
What Youll Need

Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Information Systems, Analytics, Business Administration, Operations Research, Economics or a directly related field. 
3+ years of experience within an e-commerce or corporate retail organization, preferred.
A strong interest in building a career in merchandising, operations and strategy development, with a desire to build business plans and create strategic initiatives. 
Excellent communication skills (both written & verbal), with an energetic drive to build relationships with key partners & translate complex processes for a wide group of audiences.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once (you dont miss the details)
Analytical thinker (high Excel proficiency is a must, experience with SQL/GBQ preferred), who looks for and finds answers in the data
Ability to hit the ground running  a self-starter capable of achieving specific target goals
Demonstrated potential to work as part of a cross-functional team
Desire to build business plans and create strategic initiatives.

The aptitude to effectively navigate IT systems and multiple applications simultaneously.

Title: Manager, Commercial Business Analytics
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Title: Manager, Procurement Operations
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $112,000 - $123,500 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Wayfair is looking for a Manager on our Procurement Product team to drive the ongoing optimization of our cloud-based procure-to-pay system and subsequent spend processes. This highly visible role is pivotal to standardizing our firm-wide buying process, improving our downstream financial operations, tracking spend data, unlocking process efficiencies, and maximizing our teams return on investment. We are looking for adaptable doers who are great at engaging with stakeholders, questioning inefficiencies, using data to solve problems, and multi-tasking. 
As the lead Product Manager, you will need to understand the needs of cross-functional partners across finance, accounting, engineering, and the business - then translate them into a product strategy and roadmap for our suite of Procurement tools, including Coupa, Contract Lifecycle Management, and Vendor Management System. You will need to be skilled at navigating a multitude of strong ideas, selecting the ones that will drive our agenda the furthest, and communicating the priorities back to our partners. As the internal expert and guru of our procure-to-pay systems, youll then roll up your sleeves with the Procurement Operations and partner teams to get the work done. 
You will bring a strong background in Product and/or Procurement best practices and help to drive the discovery effort of new features as well as the execution of ongoing ones. This role is ideal for someone who's both business and tech-savvy and thrives in a fast-paced environment. 
What You'll Do

Create and drive a roadmap aimed at revamping our procure-to-pay system, with a focus on results and the experience of users.
Partner with stakeholders and senior leaders across departments to understand needs, identify gaps in current processes, define product design and functional requirements, and implement a system roadmap to drive business impact.
Lead the implementation of a vendor management system.
Oversee system updates and manage the ongoing relationship with our vendor; coordinate associated change management efforts as necessary.
Develop and monitor functional performance metrics (KPIs) and devise/deploy strategies for ongoing program optimization.
Create reporting suite to distribute to category sourcing and cross-functional connections to highlight trends and opportunities to reduce spend through sourcing efforts, catalog enablement, and process improvement. 
Collaborate with engineering to review, prioritize, and action system enhancement requests and reconfigurations.

What You'll Need

4+ years experience in Product Management, procurement operations/sourcing, systems management, or strategy consultancy; experience with a cloud-based P2P system is a plus.
Bachelors degree required and preferred in an analytical field, such as economics, engineering, business, math, statistics, science, or analytics.
Ability to thrive in a high growth and entrepreneurial environment where strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities are a must.
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees and executive management.
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal.
A track record of successful relationship management skills.
An ability to hit the ground running and learn quickly; a self-starter.

The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.

Title: Data Engineer III, Growth & Discovery
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
About the Role: 
As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the Data Engineering team with this role being inherently multi-functional, and the ideal candidate will work with Data Scientist, Analysts, Application teams across the company, as well as all other Data Engineering squads at Wayfair. We are looking for someone with a love for data, understanding requirements clearly and the ability to iterate quickly. Successful candidates will have strong engineering skills and communication and a belief that data-driven processes lead to phenomenal products. 
 
What you'll do: 

Build and launch data pipelines, and data products focussed on SMART Org. 
Helping teams push the boundaries of insights, creating new product features using data, and powering machine learning models.
Build cross-functional relationships to understand data needs, build key metrics and standardize their usage across the organization. 
Utilize current and leading edge technologies in software engineering, big data, streaming, and cloud infrastructure 

 
What You'll Need: 

Bachelor/Master degree in Computer Science or related technical subject area or equivalent combination of education and experience 6+ years relevant work experience in the Data Engineering field with web scale data sets. 
Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development and data lake architecture.
Data Warehousing Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto, Airflow etc.).
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Scala, etc)
Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing and query performance tuning skills of large data sets.
Industry experience as a Big Data Engineer and working along cross functional teams such as Software Engineering, Analytics, Data Science with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.
Strong business acumen. Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using GCP technologies  Big Query, Dataproc, GCS, Cloud Composer, Dataflow or related big data technologies in other cloud platforms like AWS, Azure etc. 
Be a team player and introduce/follow the best practices on the data engineering space.
Ability to effectively communicate (both written and verbally) technical information and the results of engineering design at all levels of the organization.

 
Good to have : 

Understanding of NoSQL Database exposure and Pub-Sub architecture setup.
Familiarity with Bl tools like Looker, Tableau, AtScale, PowerBI, or any similar tools.

RoleDescription:
This is a hybrid on-site position based out of our Toronto office. (Monday/Friday Remote, Tuesday-Thursday in-office each week)

Wayfair's Customer Tech team is responsible for designing, building, analyzing, and managing the entire Customer experience on Wayfair's websites and mobile app. This role is for a person that is passionate about users and has a desire to help deliver positive consumer experiences through research.
What Youll Do
As a User Researcher on the Customer Tech team, you will be empowered to plan and run research projects end-to-end, including defining clear problem statements, framing project goals and ingoing research assumptions and questions, scoping and selecting the appropriate methods and tools, supporting in recruitment, running/facilitating research activities, analyzing and synthesizing data, sharing and socializing findings, etc. Ultimately, you will influence and persuade cross-functional leaders and more senior partners to act on your findings.

Collaboration skills - you will collaborate across functions such as Product Design, Content Strategy, Product Management, Analytics, Engineering and more

Product centric mindset  your research will be focused on the digital CX and helping product and design to discover and deliver on new opportunities

Title: Lead, Business Performance & Strategy
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Title: Sr. Specialist Business Development, B2B Retail & Design
RoleDescription:
Sr. Specialist Business Development, B2B Retail & DesignThe hourly compensation for this role is $24/hr. Overview:At Wayfair, were transforming the way businesses shop for their spacesand as an in-store B2B Sales Specialist, youll be on the front lines of that mission. This isnt your typical sales role. Youll act as a trusted partner to local businesses, helping them discover the power of Wayfair Professional and our in-store design expertise. Whether its a boutique hotel redesign, a new office buildout, or ongoing projects for local contractors, such as Interior Designers, youll be their go-to guide for all things Wayfair.
This role blends sales development, community building, and hands-on customer support. Youll grow our professional customer base by connecting with new prospects, activating and growing business from existing accounts, and working closely with in-store teams to bring large-scale projects to life. At Wayfair, we believe in hustle and heartand in this role, youll find both.
Ready to drive impact, grow your pipeline, and help businesses bring their visions to life? Lets make it happen.
What Does a B2B Sales Specialist Do?

 Grow the B2B Business: Build relationships with local Wayfair Professional customersboth new and existingby prospecting, cold calling, and community engagement. Your goal? Drive awareness, increase in-store program adoption, and help businesses unlock the full potential of the Wayfair Professional Program.
 Engage Local Wayfair Professional Customers: Proactively reach out to existing and potential B2B customers in the local market to promote the value of our in-store experience, encourage visits, and connect them with our Design Specialists. Reengage inactive accounts and uncover new opportunities through tailored outreach and relationship-building strategies.
 Prospect Net-New Customers: Use online research, walk-ins, and cold outreach to connect with business owners across industries. Youll validate enrollment status, pitch program benefits, and help them get started with Wayfair Professional.
 Build Local Partnerships: Develop relationships with area business associations, real estate developers, and design industry organizations. Share insights and collaborate with the home office to scale successful partnership models across markets.
 Coordinate Events: Partner with store leadership and marketing to host monthly in-store B2B events and identify opportunities for community engagement that showcase Wayfairs offerings and expertise.
 Support B2B Projects In-Store: Act as the go-to B2B expert for store teams and customers alike. Youll answer program questions, connect customers to the right design and delivery services, and support complex or large-scale orders.
 Enable the Team: Educate associates on B2B tools, benefits, and workflows. Collaborate closely with our instore and virtual Sales teams to ensure a seamless handoff for customers visiting our store from remote channels.

 
Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Sales Drive: 2-3 years of general sales experience with a proven track record of hitting or exceeding goalspreference in B2B development or trade environments.
 Retail Know-How: 12 years of retail experience working with customers, ideally in high-touch or specialty sales settings.
 Great Communication: Youre comfortable building rapport over the phone, in person, or via email. You know how to listen, engage, and follow up like a pro.
 Organizational Excellence: You can juggle multiple priorities without dropping the ballwhether it's planning outreach, logging customer notes in Salesforce, or coordinating an event.
 Strategic Thinking: Youre proactive in identifying opportunities, digging into data, and thinking three steps ahead to unlock growth.
 Tech Comfort: Youre familiar with CRMs (Salesforce), POS systems, and productivity tools like Google Suite.
 Team Collaboration: You thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and love partnering with others to drive results.
 Education: Bachelors degree required.
 Flexible Availability: Able to work full-time, including peak business hours, to support the needs of B2B customers in-store.
 Ability to Travel: You will be required to travel locally as needed to meet with customers, businesses, or partners. Typically this will fall within a 50-mile radius.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity:Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and performance based bonuses.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you loveplus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!
